content:
• Monday, June 18, 2012
  • BLDP

    Struggling fuel cell maker Ballard Power (NASDAQ:BLDP) is down 4.5% AH after warning it expects...

    Struggling fuel cell maker Ballard Power (NASDAQ:BLDP) is down 4.5% AH after warning it expects 2012 revenue of $85M and adjusted EBITDA of -$5M, below prior guidance of $100M and breakeven. Ballard blames delayed Brazilian and European bus orders; longer-than-expected contract negotiations with the City of Sao Paolo (previous) are taking a toll in the former case. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • ORCL

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) guides on its FQ4 earnings call (webcast) for FQ1 annual revenue growth of...

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) guides on its FQ4 earnings call (webcast) for FQ1 annual revenue growth of -2% to 1%, below a consensus of 3.3%. EPS is expected to be $0.51-$0.55, in-line with a consensus of $0.53. New software license revenue is expected to grow 0%-10%, while hardware revenue is expected to fall 7% to 17%. The company cites macro uncertainty as a reason for its cautious guidance. Shares +2.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:20 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) announces its FQ4 results three days ahead of schedule. EPS of $0.82 beat by...

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) announces its FQ4 results three days ahead of schedule. EPS of $0.82 beat by $0.04, while revenue of $11B beat by $110M. Software license revenue rose 7% Y/Y to $4B, and high-end (i.e. "engineered") hardware sales are now on a $1B+ annual run rate. In addition, a new $10B stock buyback authorization is being announced. A CC starts at 6PM ET (webcast). ORCL +5.8% AH. (earlier) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) President Michael Francis is leaving the company, effective today, after...

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) President Michael Francis is leaving the company, effective today, after just 9 months on the job. "CEO Ron Johnson will assume direct responsibility and oversight of the company's marketing and merchandising function." Shares -5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 6 Comments
  • INFO

    More on IHS (IHS): FQ2 beats across the board on a 22% jump in total revenue. Top line growth...

    More on IHS (IHS): FQ2 beats across the board on a 22% jump in total revenue. Top line growth was solid, with organic revenue growth coming in at 7% overall, including 14% growth from acquisition-related activities and 8% for its subscription-based business. Shares -2.% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +4%) has launched a CNY10/month ($1.57/month) paid membership service for users of...

    Sina (SINA +4%) has launched a CNY10/month ($1.57/month) paid membership service for users of its extremely popular Weibo microblogging platform. The service provides value-added features such as personalized pages and the ability to upload audio posts, and comes amidst close investor scrutiny of how Sina plans to monetize Weibo. Recent ad sales efforts appear to be going well.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • FSLR

    Solar stocks finish higher (TAN +2.2%) on a good day for high-beta tech names. Helping their...

    Solar stocks finish higher (TAN +2.2%) on a good day for high-beta tech names. Helping their cause is the Japanese government's unveiling of a solar subsidy program that pays solar panel owners for electricity at a rate that's 3x the one charged for conventional power. Even if domestic suppliers take a large chunk of the resulting orders, the demand boost the program stands to provide could help stabilize diving solar cell and module prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA +5.7%) gets a bump from some positive comments out of JMP Securities today,...

    NuVasive (NUVA +5.7%) gets a bump from some positive comments out of JMP Securities today, saying that after surveying top hospital executives, it believes that growth in spine surgery and back pain surgery is exceeding expectations. The firm notes that NUVA has little exposure to Europe, and ups its price target to $25 from $21.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +7.4%) shares jump after Innovate/Protect, an IP licensing firm Vringo is in the...

    Vringo (VRNG +7.4%) shares jump after Innovate/Protect, an IP licensing firm Vringo is in the process of merging with, receives a favorable Markman ruling related to a patent infringement lawsuit filed against AOL, Google (NASDAQ:GOOG), and others. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • SFD

    Smithfield Foods (SFD +7.1%) trades higher on heavy volume and with call option activity running...

    Smithfield Foods (SFD +7.1%) trades higher on heavy volume and with call option activity running 13X normal activity. Shares have now fully recovered from last week's selloff following a weak FQ4 report, as traders point to technical factors.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • HOLX

    Jefferies says Hologic's (HOLX +1.2%) pending acquisition of Gen-Probe (GPRO +0.5%) could be a...

    Jefferies says Hologic's (HOLX +1.2%) pending acquisition of Gen-Probe (GPRO +0.5%) could be a significant earnings driver for the combined company. The firm believes the combination could generate $2.68 in EPS including almost $1.00 in incremental earnings by FY15. Jefferies says HOLX is very attractive at current levels and reiterates a Buy on the name with a $24 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • QSFT

    After hardly moving most of today, Quest Software (QSFT +1.9%) has spiked to $26.68 on a...

    After hardly moving most of today, Quest Software (QSFT +1.9%) has spiked to $26.68 on a Bloomberg report that Insight Venture has topped Dell's (DELL-OLD) reported $25.50/share offer for the company. Quest remarked previously that Insight maintained "certain matching rights" related to third-party offers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (CPHD +1%) continues its upward trajectory today, having gained over 17% since last...

    Cepheid (CPHD +1%) continues its upward trajectory today, having gained over 17% since last Thursday. Credit Suisse says it remains a top SMID cap pick given its best-in-class diagnostic testing platform and strong secular growth trends. Shares are Outperform rated with a $45 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -0.7%) have settled down after a bit of wild trading this...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -0.7%) have settled down after a bit of wild trading this morning as rumors popped up that an announcement planned for later today by Microsoft would involve the company. Though execs with Barnes & Noble denied the original reports, Computer World notes that they didn't go as far as to say it didn't involve the company in any fashion whatsoever.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • AGR

    UIL Holdings (UIL +1.8%) gains after BofA Merrill Lynch upgraded the shares to Buy on relative...

    UIL Holdings (UIL +1.8%) gains after BofA Merrill Lynch upgraded the shares to Buy on relative valuation earlier today, citing the benefits of its potential gas conversions in Connecticut.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • SBUX

    Shares of Starbucks (SBUX +2.6%) swing a bit higher after word breaks that the FTC approved the...

    Shares of Starbucks (SBUX +2.6%) swing a bit higher after word breaks that the FTC approved the company's deal to buy the La Boulange bakery chain.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 3 Comments
  • OSIR

    Osiris Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OSIR) surges another 12.9% following the approval in New Zealand...

    Osiris Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OSIR) surges another 12.9% following the approval in New Zealand last week of Prochymal, the company's stem-cell therapy for acute graft-vs-host disease in children who have undergone bone marrow transplants. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • PAY

    Shares of VeriFone (PAY +6.1%) move up after UBS ups its rating to Buy from Neutral. Analysts...

    Shares of VeriFone (PAY +6.1%) move up after UBS ups its rating to Buy from Neutral. Analysts with the firm increased their price target on PAY to $48 from $37 - repping 48% upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (ORCL -2.1%) slumps after UBS writes that it expects the company to announce a major...

    Oracle (ORCL -2.1%) slumps after UBS writes that it expects the company to announce a major executive resignation by Thursday, the date of its FQ4 report. Update: Nomura's Rick Sherlund, citing an "industry source," says North American sales chief Keith Block may have left the company on Friday. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • FB

    It's another good day for recent consumer Internet IPOs, as short-covering and positive...

    It's another good day for recent consumer Internet IPOs, as short-covering and positive commentary help them add to Friday's gains. FB +6.1% GRPN +10.7%. ZNGA +5.6%. P +5%. YELP +2.7%. LNKD +4.7%. While Groupon gets a lift from a Morgan Stanley upgrade, Zynga is benefiting from bullish remarks from Wedbish's Michael Pachter. Pachter joins others in predicting new games will boost user growth, and also expects the monetization of older games to improve in 2H.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • STJ

    Lazard Capital upgrades St. Jude Medical (STJ +3.2%) to Buy, questioning concerns about a Durata...

    Lazard Capital upgrades St. Jude Medical (STJ +3.2%) to Buy, questioning concerns about a Durata defibrillator cable. A report turned up in an FDA database and was said to be due to a fraying issue, prompting fears that problems with STJ's earlier Riata product may not be isolated. But anyone can file to that database, Lazard says, and the cable wasn't returned to STJ for analysis.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 3 Comments
  • DNKN

    Execs with Dunkin' Brands ([[DNKN) +3.4%) are on the stage at the Jefferies Global Consumer...

    Execs with Dunkin' Brands ([[DNKN) +3.4%) are on the stage at the Jefferies Global Consumer Conference (webcast) pitching the case that the coffee market has enough room for McDonald's, Starbucks, and itself. On the margin front, lower coffee commodity costs should kick in later this year as the company renews contracts.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARNA

    Arena (ARNA +12.5%) shares continue their upward trajectory ahead of the FDA's decision, which...

    Arena (ARNA +12.5%) shares continue their upward trajectory ahead of the FDA's decision, which is still nine days away, on whether to approve the company's lorcaserin diet drug. Investors clearly believe the agency will approve the treatment, although market players aren't totally sure why shares are flying so high.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 36 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +5.8%) has acquired Face.com, the latter company announces on its blog. Facebook is...

    Facebook (FB +5.8%) has acquired Face.com, the latter company announces on its blog. Facebook is likely interested in both Face.com's Photo Tagger facial-recognition app, which can be applied to the billions of pictures being uploaded by Facebook users, and its valuable domain name. A May rumor about the acquisition indicated a price tag of $80-$100M. Yandex (YNDX +6.4%), which owns a stake in Face.com, appears to be rallying on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • HNHAF

    Hon Hai Precision (OTCPK:HNHAF), parent of contract manufacturer Foxconn, says it will buy more...

    Hon Hai Precision (OTCPK:HNHAF), parent of contract manufacturer Foxconn, says it will buy more shares of Sharp (OTCPK:SHCAY) due to the recent decline in the latter's shares. In March, Hon Hai announced it would take a 9.9% stake in Sharp, while chairman Terry Gou would take a 46.5% stake in the company's display ops. Today's news resulted in a 5.6% gain for Sharp on the Tokyo exchange, and has led to new speculation the tie-up is related to Apple TV production.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -9.9%) shares give back a chunk of Friday's ~30% spike, which...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -9.9%) shares give back a chunk of Friday's ~30% spike, which apparently was caused by ATPG's action in suing the U.S. government for suspending Gulf of Mexico drilling in 2010. At the least, the lawsuit was effective in turning attention away from the defection of ATPG's CEO less than a week after taking the job.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) has resumed trading following news of its $375M patent sale to Intel....

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) has resumed trading following news of its $375M patent sale to Intel. Shares are currently up 31.6% to $30.10.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • FSLR

    Solar power shares rise after Japan takes on the mantle of industry savior by approving a plan...

    Solar power shares rise after Japan takes on the mantle of industry savior by approving a plan that could lead to at least $9.6B of new installations of solar cells. Power companies will be required to buy solar energy at Y42 per kilowatt hour ($0.53) for twenty years, or about double the tariff in Germany. FSLR +5.7%, SPWR +2.6%, STP +8.15%, DSTI +19.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +5.1%) jumps higher as the prospect of seeing Model S cars on the road gets...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +5.1%) jumps higher as the prospect of seeing Model S cars on the road gets tantalizingly close. While other EV car makers gnash out which vehicle boasts the gaudiest fuel efficiency rating, Tesla is banking on the car's sporty design, tech features, and +300-mile driving range as drawing in consumers despite the high sticker price.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM | 5 Comments
  • CLBS

    Neostem (NBS +1.6%) agrees to sell 51% of its interest in Suzhou Erye Pharmaceutical, a...

    Neostem (NBS +1.6%) agrees to sell 51% of its interest in Suzhou Erye Pharmaceutical, a China-based generic pharmaceutical company, for $12.3M in cash. Included in the agreement is the the return to the company of 1.04M shares of common stock and the cancellation of 1.17M options and 640K common stock warrants, which collectively represent 1.3% of NBS' outstanding shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC), which entered the day with a market cap of $1.02B, has agreed to...

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC), which entered the day with a market cap of $1.02B, has agreed to sell roughly 1,700 of its 20K mobile patents and patent applications to Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) for $375M in cash. In tandem with the move, which follows extensive efforts to either sell the company or much of its IP, InterDigital is doubling the size of its recently-announced stock repurchase program to $200M. Shares are halted, and will resume trading at 12:15 PM ET. (INTC/RNWK)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • IMOS

    ChipMOS (IMOS +5.1%), a provider of chip packaging and testing services, is up sharply. Possibly...

    ChipMOS (IMOS +5.1%), a provider of chip packaging and testing services, is up sharply. Possibly helping are positive comments from rival Chipbond about its 2012 outlook. Chipbond says it will add new capacity this year to address strong demand for LCD driver chip packaging/testing, and that's it's also seeing healthy orders for services related to other products, such as smart card chips. (tip: Eric Gomberg) (Barron's)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • SBUX

    Analysts are starting to warm back up to Starbucks (SBUX +2.2%) after shares retreating back off...

    Analysts are starting to warm back up to Starbucks (SBUX +2.2%) after shares retreating back off from its +$60 trading heights. Piper Jaffray's Nicole Regan Miller sees current EPS estimates as too low based on the company's ability to buy coffee at lower costs in the future, while UBS' David Palmer thinks Starbucks is in line for another seasonal bounce this summer and finds valuation enticing given its growth track.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • EBAY

    eBay (EBAY +3.5%) trades higher, fueled in part by positive comments and a new initiation from...

    eBay (EBAY +3.5%) trades higher, fueled in part by positive comments and a new initiation from Keefe Bruyette at Outperform. Analysts set their price target for EBAY at $50 on their belief that the company will continue to set new multi-year highs as it remains a growth story.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • NSU

    Nevsun Resources (NSU +4%) shares are on the move after the miner says its Bisha copper...

    Nevsun Resources (NSU +4%) shares are on the move after the miner says its Bisha copper expansion project is proceeding well against schedule and budget; at the end of May, ~60% of the project was committed. NSU projects annual run-rate copper production at Bisha of 180M pounds of payable metal per year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • PWR

    Quanta (PWR +.08%), Echelon (ELON -0.9%) and EnerNOC (ENOC +11.5%) are all potential takeout...

    Quanta (PWR +.08%), Echelon (ELON -0.9%) and EnerNOC (ENOC +11.5%) are all potential takeout candidates in the smart grid space, says Piper Jaffray, after Elster (ELT +15.2%) confirmed it's in talks with Melrose to be bought for $20.50 per share. Piper notes Melrose's current bid is below recent smart grid takeout multiples, but in-line with its $21 price target for Elster.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • ITRI

    Smart meter hardware/software vendor Itron (ITRI +3.9%) rallies amidst news German rival Elster...

    Smart meter hardware/software vendor Itron (ITRI +3.9%) rallies amidst news German rival Elster (ELT +14.9%) is in talks to be acquired by P-E firm Melrose for $2.3B. Jefferies thinks Itron, which currently trades at $39, would be worth $55 or more if afforded the same multiples Melrose is giving to Elster. However, it notes Elster has more exposure to the fast-growing gas metering market.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC +5.2%) shares surge on positive new comments from Papua New Guinea president Peter...

    InterOil (IOC +5.2%) shares surge on positive new comments from Papua New Guinea president Peter O'Neil, who reiterated strong support for IOC's Gulf LNG project over the weekend. PNG's Department of Petroleum and Energy has been seeking to cancel the 2009 project agreement between the country and IOC.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM Radio (SIRI -1.6%) falls back on above-average volume with the anticipated sale of...

    Sirius XM Radio (SIRI -1.6%) falls back on above-average volume with the anticipated sale of shares by Mel Karmazin this week or next sitting as an overhang. Though the block sales are part of 10b5-1 plan not related to any non-public information, SIRI has still taken a hit each time one of Karmazin's transactions is officially announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 3 Comments
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +2.3%) announces an alliance with BNSF Railway to build a 15K-ton silica sand...

    U.S. Silica (SLCA +2.3%) announces an alliance with BNSF Railway to build a 15K-ton silica sand storage facility in San Antonio, Tex., to support the oil and gas extraction industry in the Eagle Ford shale. SLCA anticipates three to four shipments per month of ~10K tons of frac sand on BNSF trains from its Ottawa, Ill., sand mine to meet the industry's need for proppant.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • KCAP

    Kohlberg Capital (NASDAQ:KCAP) +6.7% after it increases its dividend by $0.06 to $0.24/share,...

    Kohlberg Capital (NASDAQ:KCAP) +6.7% after it increases its dividend by $0.06 to $0.24/share, with the rise attributable "in large part" to the firm's acquisition of Trimaran Advisors in February. Kohlberg has adopted a "dividend reinvestment plan" in which it will reinvest the dividends in the company's shares on behalf of stockholders unless they elect to receive cash. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • NAV

    Shares of Navistar International (NYSE:NAV) continue their bouncy trading ways, losing 5.2% in...

    Shares of Navistar International (NYSE:NAV) continue their bouncy trading ways, losing 5.2% in early action. The future direction of Navistar is unsettled with two activist investor stepping up their stakes (I, II) and the company still battling the EPA over emission standards for its truck engines.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -1.1%) falls back from an early gain after the company says that it...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -1.1%) falls back from an early gain after the company says that it won't be part of Microsoft's tablet announcement today. Shares were fueled in early trading by a TechCrunch story that speculated the company would be front and center in Microsoft's plans for its next tablet.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX +6.7%) surges to new all-time highs after making a flurry of product and customer...

    Mellanox (MLNX +6.7%) surges to new all-time highs after making a flurry of product and customer announcements. Among them: a new InfiniBand adapter card called Connect-IB, aimed at demanding server and storage environments, and deals (I, II) with Australia's national science agency and a Texas research facility to supply InfiniBand adapter cards and switches for high-performance computing applications. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • SHOO

    A profit warning from DSW spills over to taint the shares of other shoe sellers on similar...

    A profit warning from DSW spills over to taint the shares of other shoe sellers on similar concerns that demand will falter and margins will get squeezed. Decliners: SHOO -4.1%, GCO -3.7%, BWS -2.6%, SCVL -2.1%, CROX -1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • KVPBQ

    The FDA says its analysis of compounded versions of the active ingredient in K-V...

    The FDA says its analysis of compounded versions of the active ingredient in K-V Pharmaceuticals’ (KV.A -16.2%) Makena premature-birth prevention drug did not identify any major safety problems, but the agency reiterates that approved drugs are generally safer and more effective than compounded products.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR +2.4%) shares could jump to $30 on an upswing in natural gas prices,...

    Nabors Industries (NBR +2.4%) shares could jump to $30 on an upswing in natural gas prices, Barron's believes. NBR, which raised investors' ire with its generous perks and packages for its former CEO, is back on track with a strategic and cultural transformation thanks to new CEO Anthony Petrello, the weekend report says.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • DSW

    Shares of DSW (DSW -12.1%) fall off after the company warns that FQ2 earnings will be worse than...

    Shares of DSW (DSW -12.1%) fall off after the company warns that FQ2 earnings will be worse than analysts forecast due to its reliance on clearance sales to move inventory out the door.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • HUN

    Huntsman (NYSE:HUN) -2.1% premarket after shares are downgraded to Hold from Buy at KeyBanc:...

    Huntsman (NYSE:HUN) -2.1% premarket after shares are downgraded to Hold from Buy at KeyBanc: "While continued positive trends in U.S. architectural and housing markets should have some positive impact, more significant improvement in results will require a reversal in trends in Europe and developing markets, such as China, where growth rates are slowing."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • BKI-OLD

    Buckeye Technologies (NYSE:BKI-OLD) says that a plant in Florida has been temporarily closed due...

    Buckeye Technologies (NYSE:BKI-OLD) says that a plant in Florida has been temporarily closed due the "significant failure" of a steam drum on a paper machine. The company expects to provide a production update later this week. Shares -3.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) -2.5% thanks to a downgrade to Neutral from JPMorgan, which thinks...

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) -2.5% thanks to a downgrade to Neutral from JPMorgan, which thinks investors should take profits after Rambus' recent run-up. JPMorgan, one of only two major sell-side firms to maintain coverage on the volatile memory technology company, isn't optimistic about a pending ITC case involving multiple chipmakers, as well as ongoing IP litigation. Rambus rose 14% on Friday in the absence of major news. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -2.1% premarket after saying it expects to generate a Q2 profit of...

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -2.1% premarket after saying it expects to generate a Q2 profit of $0.04-$0.06/share, vs. $0.11 consensus and a Q1 EPS loss of $0.11. AKS cites "uncertainty and volatility with respect to near-term economic conditions in the United States and in other markets served by the company, including a recent deterioration in spot market pricing."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are well into the red and tracking EU shares, which have given up...

    Market preview: Stock futures are well into the red and tracking EU shares, which have given up the ghost due to Spain's continued woes; stocks had rallied following victory for the pro-bailout crew in Greece. S&P benchmark futures -0.5%. More happily, Barnes & Noble +8.65% on speculation it's going to build a tablet with Microsoft. Later: NAHB Housing Market Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) +4.4% on an upgrade to Overweight from Morgan Stanley. The firm, which is...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) +4.4% on an upgrade to Overweight from Morgan Stanley. The firm, which is setting a PT of $18, cites a lower valuation, and thinks rivals such as Google Offers, AmazonLocal, and LivingSocial have "not gained meaningful traction or deployed new innovations." Groupon rallied on Friday along with other recently-battered Internet names. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • AUY

    Premarket gainers: XG +53%. ELT +19%. BVSN +6%. Losers: OTCQB:BODY -30%. INFI -16%. DSW -9%. ING...

    Premarket gainers: XG +53%. ELT +19%. BVSN +6%.
    Losers: OTCQB:BODY -30%. INFI -16%. DSW -9%. ING -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) run up a 7.6% premarket gain off of speculation that the...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) run up a 7.6% premarket gain off of speculation that the company will announce a partnership with Microsoft to develop a tablet. The spin is that the company's NewCo subsidiary will supply the content for a Microsoft-charged device as the company subtly backs off from competing against the new partnership.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI) -2.6% premarket after the Defense Department's Friday announcement that it...

    SAIC (SAI) -2.6% premarket after the Defense Department's Friday announcement that it awarded Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) the $4.6B DISA GSM-O contract to run the DoDs global network. This was SAI's largest contract, generating more than $400M/year in revenues. Stifel Nicolaus cuts FY 2014 estimates to reflect the loss but leaves FY13 unchanged given likely transition delays from a potential protest.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • BODY

    Body Central (OTCQB:BODY) says that it expects Q2 EPS to come in at $0.19-$0.21, a mark that...

    Body Central (OTCQB:BODY) says that it expects Q2 EPS to come in at $0.19-$0.21, a mark that falls short of the consensus estimate of analysts that calls for $0.27. The company cites continued soft comparable store sales and the need for it to aggressively markdown slow moving items as factors in sharply reducing its guidance. Shares -24.9% premarket.

  • INFI

    Infinity Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:INFI) -20% after saying it's ending Phase 2 studies of its...

    Infinity Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:INFI) -20% after saying it's ending Phase 2 studies of its saridegib drug for treating bone and cartilage cancers due to disappointing results. It's another blow for Infinity with saridegib, which failed trials for pancreatic cancer earlier this year. Infinity has a cash runway until 2014 and will update its 2012 guidance in August.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM

    Extorre Gold Mines (XG) +54% premarket after agreeing to be acquired by Yamana Gold (NYSE:AUY) for ~C$414M, or C$4.26/share in cash and stock, a 68% premium to Friday's closing price in Toronto. AUY says the "tuck-in" acquisition fits its criteria, including "opportunity for organic growth, accelerated path to development and production, and high return."
